summary: Email chain between court officials regarding public and victim access procedures for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, including COVID-19 protocols and correction of outdated information on a public website.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Jury Selection Begins
events.description: Jury selection for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell commenced.

events.title: Court Order on Trial Access
events.description: Southern District of New York Court issued procedures for public access to the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Updated Court Order on Trial Access
events.description: Court issued updated procedures for public access to the Maxwell trial.

locations: Southern District of New York courthouse
keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell began with jury selection on November 29, 2021.
Court procedures allowed public access only through in-person attendance with COVID-19 protocols, not via telephone or broadcast.
Victim access to the trial was coordinated through the U.S. Attorney's Office Victim-Witness Coordinator and Joseph Pecorino.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were enforced including temperature checks, masks, and health questionnaires.
Outdated information on a public website was causing confusion about trial access methods.
